Question: AGK-071 - Which gauges involve a measurement of temperature?

Question: AGK-072 - Fuel quantity in small aircraft is most commonly measured through a level sensor. The European Certification Specifications CS 23 require that...

Question: AGK-073 - Which of the instruments listed below obtain their readings through pressure measurement?
Correct: Oil pressure gauge, fuel pressure gauge, manifold pressure gauge, altimeter, vertical speed indicator, airspeed indicator, suction gauge

Correct: altitude above the reference pressure level 1013.25 hPa.

Question: AGK-078 - Which is the purpose of the altimeter subscale?
Correct: To reference the altimeter reading to a predetermined level such as mean sea level, aerodrome level or pressure level 1013.25 hPa

Question: AGK-079 - In which way may an altimeter subscale which is set to an incorrect QNH lead to an incorrect altimeter reading?
Correct: If the subscale is set to a higher than actual pressure, the indication is too high. This may lead to much closer proximity to the ground than intended

Question: AGK-089 - Calibrated airspeed (CAS) equals...
Correct: indicated airspeed (IAS) corrected for instrument and position error.
